snippet: It is unlikely that Blatter will try to remain FIFA’s president, but it cannot be ruled out, if only because FIFA has proven itself capable of just about anything.
abstract: Sam Borden On Soccer column observes that while it is unlikely that Sepp Blatter will attempt to retain his FIFA presidency after announcing his resignation, it is not out of the realm of possibility for an organization that has proven itself capable of anything; examines current state of scandal.
lead_paragraph: It is unlikely that Blatter will try to remain FIFA’s president, but it cannot be ruled out, if only because FIFA has proven itself capable of just about anything.

headline.print_headline: After the Resignation, Chatter About a Blatter Revival
headline.main: Too Much at Risk for Sepp Blatter to Renege on Vow to Resign
